授業目的: The big disparity between rich countries and poor countries are well-known. Looking back, however, the rich countries were not necessarily rich in the past. Why some countries are poor (under-developed) and how the others have become rich (developed) are the themes of development economics. This course offers standard development economics to consider how and where the disparity between the two groups of countries is going to go.
到達目標: Students will learn current economic differences in the world and mechanisms behind them, understand the role and necessity of international cooperation and be motivated to contribute themselves to the world.
授業の概要・背景: studends are expected to learn the concepts and tools to analyze development issues, to know better current development issues by accessing the media such as the Economist, and to think development and policies for development with historical as well as analytical perspectives.
